content:
Diagnosis:

Metastatic right breast cancer with liver, bone and brain metastases
Initial diagnosis March 2023 - Grade 2 invasive lobular carcinoma, ER 7/8, PR 2/8, HER2 positive

Previous Cancer History:
Left breast DCIS 2015 - treated with mastectomy, disease-free

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes
Osteoarthritis

Current medications:
Pertuzumab/Trastuzumab/Docetaxel
Dexamethasone
Aprepitant
Ondansetron
Levetiracetam 750mg BD
Dexamethasone 4mg BD

Current situation:
Cycle 4 of 6 planned cycles pertuzumab/trastuzumab/docetaxel

I was very concerned to see [redacted name] today who has unfortunately experienced significant clinical deterioration since our last review. She attended with her daughter who reports increasing confusion and unsteady gait over the past week. Her performance status has declined from 1 to 3, now spending most of the day in bed or chair.

She has developed grade 3 peripheral neuropathy affecting both feet, making walking very difficult. She also describes worsening bone pain despite recent palliative radiotherapy to T4-T6 (20Gy in 5 fractions completed 15/4/24). Her liver function tests show progressive derangement with ALT 156 and ALP 345.

MRI brain performed yesterday shows progression of known cerebral metastases with increasing perilesional edema, explaining her neurological deterioration. CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows mixed response - partial response in liver metastases but new bone lesions in pelvis and thoracic spine.

After careful discussion with [redacted name] and her daughter, we have decided to discontinue docetaxel due to cumulative neurotoxicity. We will continue HER2-directed therapy with pertuzumab/trastuzumab alone. I have increased her dexamethasone to 8mg BD for symptom control and referred urgently to the palliative care team for enhanced support at home. She will need urgent repeat MRI brain in 2 weeks to assess if further whole brain radiotherapy is indicated.

Plan:
1. Discontinue docetaxel
2. Continue pertuzumab/trastuzumab
3. Increase dexamethasone to 8mg BD
4. Urgent palliative care review
5. MRI brain in 2 weeks
6. Review in combined oncology/palliative care clinic next week
